curam.util.common
Interface JDEExceptionType

All Known Implementing Classes:
ClientException, ClientPlugInException, ConversionException, DataAccessException, DataAccessSecurityException, DomainException, JDEException, MarshalException, MessageException, PlugInException, RequestException
public interface JDEExceptionType

An interface that describes the features provided by JDE-compatible exceptions. This allows both core JDE exceptions and exceptions derived from third-party exception types to be handled consistently by the infrastructure when errors must be reported.

All JDE-compatible exceptions support JDE messages, provide the details of the message catalog storing the message and the facility to convert the message reference to a localized string for reporting.

Ideally, this interface should be called "JDEException" and the existing "JDEException" class should be named "AbstractJDEException", but this would require code that wishes to catch all JDE exceptions to catch the awkwardly named "AbstractJDEException", as an interface named "JDEException" could not extend the java.lang.Exception class necessary to use it in a "try-catch" statement.

Method Detail

getMessage

java.lang.String getMessage(java.util.Locale locale)
Gets a message string appropriate for a specific locale (not just the system default locale, which is no good for a server-side application). The message will be localized and built by applying the defined message localizer and message builder to the message object.

Parameters:
locale - The locale to use to translate the message.
Returns:
The localized message text for this exception.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - If the message cannot be created. The exception will wrap the underlying exception.

getMessageObject

Message getMessageObject()
Gets the message object maintained by this exception. The JDE-style exceptions all store a message object independently from the inherited exception message string. This object is more suitable for localization and argument substitution than the simple string available from the Java classes.

Returns:
The message object managed by this exception.

toString

java.lang.String toString(java.util.Locale locale)
Converts the exception to a string representation that includes the class name of the exception and the string representations of all the exceptions in the chain of causal exceptions. This works when all of the exceptions in the chain are JDE-style exceptions, but any non-JDE-style exceptions will break the chain at that point. However, the inherited printStackTrace methods will still display the exception chain, if somewhat more verbosely.

Parameters:
locale - The locale to be used.
Returns:
The localized string representation.

getMessageLocalizer

MessageLocalizer getMessageLocalizer()
Gets the message localizer that will be used to select the correct message string for a message identifier and locale. Typically, this will be a localizer that looks up the identifier in a message catalog, but there are other possibilities.

Returns:
The message localizer.

getMessageBuilder

curam.util.common.message.MessageBuilder getMessageBuilder()
Gets the message builder used to insert arguments into the message string. Different exceptions may use different message builders to support different formatting type codes for argument placeholders or that build messages in other ways.

Returns:
The message builder.
